website_summaries.verdict: A popular brand that holds a certain level of aesthetic appeal. Stands out for its all-round cushioning.
pros: 360-degree padding that works to protect entire foot
Cuffs don’t easily slide down the legs
Polyester and spandex blend offers excellent moisture wicking qualities
cons: They fall short when it comes to odor control
A handful of owners feel they’re a tad too long

customer_reviews.title: Best Socks That Will Rock Your Socks Off!
customer_reviews.text: These Adidas white socks have given me more happiness in my life than any other thing in this world could. They have comfortably fit onto my skinny, brown feet for a few weeks now, and I can guarantee you that my feet have never felt more secure and relaxed while serving McChickens to my lovely customers. 10/10 recommend these puppies for all people of all shapes and sizes.
customer_reviews.author: BunnyOfAwesomeness

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these socks for my son because of the low price and because he wears holes in socks like crazy. That was nearly a year ago, and he just now wore out one pair of the six-pack. I am so impressed that these socks have lasted this long! My son is an active senior in high school, wearing these socks to football practice and games, wrestling practice/tournaments, and now rugby. Not to mention landscaping (summer job last year), skate boarding, basketball with friends, bicycling, and triathlon training. I don't usually take the time to write reviews, but these socks kick a**!!
customer_reviews.author: ayreshead

customer_reviews.title: Wore out after wearing for one day
customer_reviews.text: The socks are comfortable enough. But they are very poor quality. When I took them off after wearing them for 1 day, I was shocked to see that they had already pilled on the bottom and threads were coming loose. I was just walking around the mall in my running shoes -- nothing very demanding. I also found that that fit quite large. It is too bad that I did not try them out before the Amazon return deadline. I assumed they were up to Adidas quality standards and did not open the package. I don't know if these are fakes or if Adidas quality has slipped that much. I have other socks I have worn for years.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor H

customer_reviews.title: Not what was expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought these socks, because the description was identical, as was the material composition, to Adidas socks bought in a local sporting goods store. These socks are significantly thinner. Next time, I will purchase at a local store to make sure the material is the same comfortable thickness as my original package.
customer_reviews.author: Poor old dadTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Lousy socks!!!
customer_reviews.text: These socks looked good in the photo but they are pure trash. The foot section is way too long and the leg portion is way too tight. The material is super thin as well. Perhaps, if you have a very long foot, (size 12 maybe), and a very skinny calf, plus you like an extremely thin fabricl, these socks would be perfect for you! I've had Adidas socks before and never had a problem. How they came up with such a long foot section and such a skinny leg section is beyond me. Do yourself a favor and avoid these socks at all costs. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: martinJ

customer_reviews.title: Should not be listed as an 'athletic' sock when they are worthless for sports.
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised that these socks are rated so high. Considering that they are listed as an athletic sock, out of any athletic sock I've ever owned, they lasted the shortest amount of time....by far. They are very comfortable, they have a stretchy feel to them, but they rip SO EASILY. Comfortable yes, for athletics....unless you don't mind replacing them very often...absolutely not.
customer_reviews.author: Keithian

customer_reviews.title: Socks don't pair up in length....
customer_reviews.text: Update: After wearing them for awhile I noticed that they're all slightly different in length. It's weird. No sock matches another in length....it's annoying some are shorter some are longer. They were all supposed to be one length.... Original review : These socks are great, I would like them to be a little tighter on the calf, as they tend to slid down throughout the day. I recommend these socks!
customer_reviews.author: Dino Duss

customer_reviews.title: Not the Same Quality
customer_reviews.text: I wish manufacturers wouldn’t get consumers hooked on their products and then quietly and surreptitiously change the quality, but that is what happened here. These socks are not the same quality they used to be. I still have the older version and it is clear when looking at each side by side that Adidas is trying to save some money on material. This new version is practically shear on the top. I can see my feet through the sock! Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: frivolacious squidigation

customer_reviews.title: Not the correct sock.
customer_reviews.text: The one reason people purchase this sock is not for sports or durability, it’s the style in which the Adidas branding appears for this sock. To say I was disappointed when I got this is an understatement. I’m leaving for vacation in 2 days and my washing machine seems to love these socks so I had to get more. But, guess I won’t have them! Props to whoever does the Adidas fulfillment through amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Smith

customer_reviews.title: For size M10-12 only
customer_reviews.text: I bought these socks in 2017 and I loved them. I am a male with 8.5 size feet and they fit perfectly. They also wicked away foot sweat much better than cotton socks. When I re-ordered the same thing according to Amazon what arrived was significantly larger. Adidas appears to have combined 2 sizes into 1 size fits all. Anyway these new socks are loose fitting, and I would only recommend them for someone with a foot size 10-12. They are fine for work but not for sports. I will look for someone who makes 6-9 and 9-12 sock sizes vs making the same sock for 6 different shoe sizes (facepalm).
customer_reviews.author: Rob Neff

customer_reviews.title: Hold up well
customer_reviews.text: I have had these socks for a few years now. I don’t think I have got a hole in any of them. However, my washing machine eats one every once in a while. They still have fit well, haven’t stretched and stay pulled up as well as new socks. Would buy again, but these haven’t warn out yet.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Southern

customer_reviews.title: New favorite socks
customer_reviews.text: Love these socks ❤️ I thought they were reasonable at $15 for 6 pairs. They are very soft, have good support. Not too thick. I tried some Under Armor socks and they're kind of thick, making my feet sweat more and too hot. These are much better. My feet are thanking me on the morning jog. I would definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: The quality of these socks are the equivalent of a ...
customer_reviews.text: The quality of these socks are the equivalent of a sock manufactured by Walmart. The fact of this product being marketed as having a "cushioned" characteristic is a joke and was obviously a poorly worded description that came from a first year marketing graduate. These socks are paper thin and you can see right through them with no trouble at all. They make your feet dry, they are uncomfortable, and by no means should they be considered an "athletic sock". A company such as Adidas should not be manufacturing socks or any product for that matter that is the sub par equivalent of a cheaply made pair of Walmart panty hose.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I've ordered these multiple times, and they're fairly good
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The socks are very comfortable The socks breathe very well in comparison to similar socks I've gotten. The socks have a great quality for the price that you pay and the quantity that you receive. Cons: The socks break down with holes after about 1-1.5 years of use. I don't think I've had any of them last (I've ordered 3 times) for more than a year and a half. Please give this review a 'helpful' rating if it was useful to you! :)
customer_reviews.author: Saleh Mostafa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect socks....
customer_reviews.text: EXACTLY what I wanted in a sock: All polyester but with a tiny hint of spandex. I don't like cotton because it is a very absorbent material. Because of that, it really dries out the skin. These polyester socks contain no cotton, so they are comfortable and very easy on the skin. This is my third foray into buying Adidas brand socks and I am not disappointed. Adidas socks are way better than Nike, Under Armor, and whatever else. Get these. If you're anything like me, won't be unhappy with them.
customer_reviews.author: jefal-20

customer_reviews.title: Worth socks
customer_reviews.text: My husband is so in love with this socks. They are thick and strong. Our dog also likes the socks as well. He let him takes and play with his socks which is I don’t really happy about and he miss match so many socks because of the dog but with this socks I don’t have much problem because they look the same and less wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: Mia Falco

customer_reviews.title: Follow Directions When Drying
customer_reviews.text: The sock drying directions do tell you to dry them on the low setting. However, if your dryer gets hot on the low setting, do not dry them there. My son dried them on low, and they kind of melted and lost their shape. Our dryer here at our house does not get hot on the low settings, but some commercial dryers do get hot on low, and the one he used where he lived got hot, even on low. I would give these 5 stars if the socks were not so sensitive to heat.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Red Rider

customer_reviews.title: My favorite socks
customer_reviews.text: These are me and my sons favorite socks so far. They breathe and add some cushion which lets face it is needed these days with most shoes. They hold up well as long as you aren’t wearing them without shoes on. My son has worn holes in the heels of about 10 pair by wearing them around the house and on the concrete without shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Mule45

customer_reviews.title: There is no nylon in these socks
customer_reviews.text: These Adidas socks indicate a mixture of polyester, Spandex and nylon (see image). The actual socks carry a label that indicates 97% polyester and 3% spandex (see image). I was looking for a sock made from a polyester/nylon blend and was disappointed to discover that these socks have no nylon content. Update: As for wear, one pair has a hole in the heel already after wearing them twice (see image). Not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Robert McGill

customer_reviews.title: Good socks
customer_reviews.text: I like these socks. I ordered them because I was looking for a pair of Adidas socks that match what I had purchased at a local JC Penny. I bought these because the stitching looked identical in the photo provided. I gave 4/5 because these seem to be a thinner than the ones I purchased at the store. However, they are comfortable and fit well so I've rated 4/5 (although I really want to find the ones -anywhere- less thin).
customer_reviews.author: B. Pell

customer_reviews.title: Middle of the road product. Not great. Not terrible
customer_reviews.text: 1) great price and good band that is snug. These don’t fall. My son says they can be too snug sometimes. 2) doesn’t wick sweat. Bummer. 3). Wears out easy in sole. Bummer. Holes appear faster than w other socks we have.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. J.

customer_reviews.title: comfy and they control foot odor if he feet sweat The best feature is that the top elastic is not to ...
customer_reviews.text: These are the only socks my husband will wear now. He says they are soft, comfy and they control foot odor if he feet sweat The best feature is that the top elastic is not to tight that they leave rings of swelling above his socks. But they continue to hold there elasticity (not fall down) wash after wash.
customer_reviews.author: Holly M

customer_reviews.title: You better like your socks with holes
customer_reviews.text: I looked back on my orders and I have 3 orders since September 29, 2017 in which each time I ordered 2 packs of 6 of these socks which makes 36 pair. These socks are very comfortable, but not durable at all. My son, who is 16 and a baseball player, and I wear these. I have never seen a pair of socks fall apart like these to make holes. I threw away my last pair today because of holes. I am not buying anymore of these adidas crew socks.
customer_reviews.author: rbd

customer_reviews.title: Low quality materials
customer_reviews.text: These do not have the feel of athletic socks. Pretty disappointing that these are more like poor quality dress socks with low quality materials that make your feet feel sweaty all the time. I just got these and after my first day with these I will not use these again.
customer_reviews.author: wharrison

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: They only reason they can say these are "cushioned" is because the rest of the sock are super thin. Like, see-through thin. Almost feels like tight dress socks. And boy are they slippery, even to grab and pull on. Wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: FH

customer_reviews.title: Too tall and too hot
customer_reviews.text: These socks reach much higher up the calf than I prefer. About 3/4” of the way up to my knee, or 11-12” above the ankle (I’m 5’11”). This is quit e a bit higher than other crew socks I’ve owned. The material itself is pretty nice to the touch. But despite being a bit thin, they retain more heat than I’d like. So my feet are uncomfortably warm. So disappointing overall.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Quality control not super great
customer_reviews.text: The socks are comfortable, albeit a bit longer than they show in the product photos. My biggest concern is that one of the socks had a pretty big ripped thread on the side. It wasn't worth initiating a return for one sock so I just tried my best to repair it, but still super frustrating to get something like that for the price paid.
customer_reviews.author: M. Rivero

customer_reviews.title: Tight on my legs????
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these; I’m a woman. And I can’t help but wonder the kind of twig legs someone would need for these to be even minutely comfortable socks. I’m an average size woman, with normal size calves. These socks are so tight that they dig into my calves and leave itchy marks that last for hours. It’s extremely uncomfortable and annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Talbert

customer_reviews.title: I’m pretty rough on socks
customer_reviews.text: I’m pretty rough on socks. I buy black ones for that reason. These are by far the worst socks I’ve purchased. Probably got about 2 months out of them. From 1 to 3 best to worse I’ll rate: 1. Under Armour Socks 2. Nike Socks (elasticity wears out and fall down. They get tossed at that point) 3. Adidas Socks - bottom of socks have wear holes.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni

customer_reviews.title: Not cushioned enough
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband and he says they aren't cushioned, or warm enough. Too light to wear in the winter, but might wear them when it gets hotter. Wish he would have told me before the return window had closed. I would have returned them and tried something else. I have women's Adidas crew socks, and the older ones are more cushioned(but pill badly) than the newer ones but haven't had the newer ones long enough to see if they will pill too.
customer_reviews.author: SmilinHeart

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for working out and running. I have close to size 13 feet and these fit great. A bit snug at the tops with the elastic, but not too tight. The socks themselves are medium thick (be sure you get this larger size if that's you too) and very soft and comfortable and seem like they'll be pretty durable. I'm going to order more for my street shoes too since they look great (I got the gray color) and I think these are a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: 1/2 good...1/2 not so much
customer_reviews.text: The socks are well made and the bottom are comfortable. However, from the ankle up they were way too tight. The elasticity of the upper part left marks on my legs after just a few minutes. These may be great if you have skinny legs, if not, then "not so much". 1 pair gone, 5 pair donated to charity.
customer_reviews.author: Sprintrps

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: My husband said that there’s not “Athletic” about these socks. He usually wears Gold Toe athletic socks but I saw these and thought they were comparable to the Gold Toe he normally wears. He said they feel a little like slightly thicker dress socks and asked me to never purchase these socks for him again. :-/
customer_reviews.author: 4Teacup

customer_reviews.title: Best running socks
customer_reviews.text: These socks are great. First i am a 13 US Sneaker. I ordered under big and tall (12-15) Fit perfect. They stay up on your legs perfectly and I washed a few times already. I washed them in cold gentle and hang dry. They are still perfect after a few washings. soft and comfi. toe area is great. I ordered a second pack already. Highly recommend them-very warm and I run in Buffalo NY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael M. Buffalo NY

customer_reviews.title: Sock U
customer_reviews.text: I only buy these ADIDAS socks. Well; these and their ankle socks and a few heavy winter socks. I hate having to search through a thousand socks to find 2 that match. Buy all the same type and the problem is solved. These socks seem to last a little wile while being comfortable and stylish. I'm deducting one star because I wish the toe lasted a little longer but they're still worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Replaced entire sock drawer with these!
customer_reviews.text: I love these socks so much, that I 8 sets of the 6 pair to replace all the other socks in my sock drawer. No more mismatched pairs, and a ton of comfy socks to wear around ! Seriously, they are breathable, comfy, non-smelly, and the compression is just right (not too tight that they leave sock marks at the end of the day). Not to mention for a six pair pack, these are relatively inexpensive compared to other brands of similar quality socks. Point is, I like em a lot
customer_reviews.author: Matt G

customer_reviews.title: Great socks - poor packaging
customer_reviews.text: I like the socks. The fit is great. They offer light compression and stay up all day. The packaging made pulls in half the socks. The little Ts are tight and embed in the material. I tried to work them out carefully but stilled snagged.
customer_reviews.author: BackStreet

customer_reviews.title: Not great. Quality has gone downhill. Very thin now, a lot of synthetic material
customer_reviews.text: This brand used to be a good quality, thick cotton sock. Now it's mostly a synthetic fiber. The result: after 1 wear and 1 wash the material is pilling and you can see through it in some places. Literally ONE wear and ONE wash. It's like they are disposable socks. So, if you want some disposable socks, these are for you.
customer_reviews.author: lizzie97202

customer_reviews.title: Too tight around the Calves
customer_reviews.text: These socks are too tight around the calves. They’re supposed to be made to fit people with larger feet except whoever made these in the factory made the opening for the Cavs for somebody who’s got little tiny feet. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer MCPSU

customer_reviews.title: Decent Adidas Socks
customer_reviews.text: My son said these socks are pretty comfortable. They are a little stretchy and do not move too much when he is running. They stay up on the leg and do not roll down. Good socks, great deal, especially getting them all one color makes doing laundry easier for me!
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Difference in opinion between me and my son.
customer_reviews.text: My son says that these socks are really a 5 star and they are really comfy. It fits perfectly and has held up pretty well with daily use. Me, his mom, had to say it's only a four star -- only because it does retain his foot odor after he takes off his socks. I mean the smell does stay in until it's washed. So that's why the difference in rating.
customer_reviews.author: Pat K

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong.  Affordable and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These sock's fit very well and overall is comfortable. The only part of this sock that I would like to see made differently would be on the top of the foot. You can see the skin thought the top but maybe that is designed to release heat. Time will tell if they hold up but as for now they are a pretty good bang for my buck.
customer_reviews.author: Flash2k3

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: These were small at the start. After using them for a month decided it is reducing circulation and just plain uncomfortable by being too small. My size is in the middle of the size range for these socks. Suspect they are not true addidas socks which passed QA but a rejected lot or knock off.
customer_reviews.author: abcnerd

customer_reviews.title: Def not for larger than size 11 even the xl
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with these. I ordered size 12-15 and they are way to small and tight for a size 13 foot. No way this fits a size 14 or more. I was so happy to have finally found socksnthat are big enough but this wasn’t it.
customer_reviews.author: hlhs mama

customer_reviews.title: They wear well.
customer_reviews.text: These socks are soft easy to wash, no tangles. There feel good and your feat well be happy in them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall worth it
customer_reviews.text: Took a while to get used to the material as I'm used to more of a cotton blend, but after you get over the material they're using, they can be quite comfortable but seem like they are more comfortable after a few (3-5) washes.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M.

customer_reviews.title: A lot of support.
customer_reviews.text: These socks are made of a heavy material and provide a lot more ankle support than I would have ever expected. I have just got them so I won't comment on the longeivity, but they appear to by well constructed with quality materials.
customer_reviews.author: Rick A. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Good warm comfortable socks.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for our local Community Services Non-Profit. Great for folks living outdoors with limited shelter opportunities. Nothing like dry feet to make one feel a little bit better. The quality of these socks seemed fairly good. They were soft and well made. Recommend purchasing a pack and forwarding to your local community non-profit service agency. Would purchase again. UPDATE: just completed my third purchase. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Peter DP

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable socks!
customer_reviews.text: These socks fit and feel WONDERFUL. They are perfectly sized for me (size 11.5-12 shoe, average-volume feet, ankles and calves) and they're extremely comfortable. I use them as dress socks, but do note that they are probably 2-3 times as thick as actual dress socks. I like that fact, and have shoes that accommodate that, but you have to keep that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: F. Tate

customer_reviews.title: Thin, durable, but your feet will still sweat.
customer_reviews.text: The socks are thin but durable, they wear like dress socks. Your feet won't sweat as much as dress socks, but more so than cotton socks. They do not leave lint on your feet, like cotton socks do. I don't recommend them for working out, but are fine as an everyday alternative to dress socks.
customer_reviews.author: William B Pyles

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought Gold Toe
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed! Should of bought a Gold Toe! One pair developed a hole Shortly after buying. They are only used for my morning run. First use and a big hole! I have Gold Toe socks that last for years!
customer_reviews.author: Mikel John

customer_reviews.title: Packaging FAIL
customer_reviews.text: Nice socks...unfortunately now they have holes in them. The way they package these things it is impossible not to put holes in them when unwrapping them. I don't get it...Isn't Adidas a giant well-run company that ships millions of socks every year?? Frustrating, Adidas!
customer_reviews.author: Terry McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Very poor fit
customer_reviews.text: The socks are way too long and are very narrow and tight. They cut off the circulation in my legs. They are so long I could pull them up to my knees. Just not comfortable and not at all like the same brand I had bought a few years ago.
customer_reviews.author: DaveB

customer_reviews.title: Very small, thin
customer_reviews.text: These were supposed to fit 6-12 but are very small. See picture. They are thinner than other adidas socks ive bought with same material list. Mine are very thin almost like dress socks after stretching over my foot. Based on reviews i think they are selling different skews under the same listing. Maybe yours will be thick, maybe thin, who knows.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Keep lookin
customer_reviews.text: Not good. I bought these looking for something synthetic for sweaty feet, hoping to stave off athletes foot. They are the opposite of wicking. My socks come out damp at the end of the work day. And the absolute worst part is they stretch out like crazy. So they fit good at first but after a few washes they loosen and get bunched up at the toe, so you pull them up tighter and the heel ends up being closer to your ankle. Usually Adidas makes higher quality stuff than this, disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Much too tight
customer_reviews.text: For me these socks are unwearable, so tight they're hard to get on, and even harder to get off. I weigh 135 so my weight isn't the problem. Waste of $, maybe I'll make sock puppets out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Lee DeBree

customer_reviews.title: The synthetic materials made my feet hot and felt like they were sweating nonstop
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these because I had a positive experience with other Adidas crew socks. These socks, however, were so unpleasant that I threw them away after a few wears. The synthetic materials made my feet hot and felt like they were sweating nonstop. As a result, I sweated more and found these socks more prone to odors than other socks. Just unpleasant all around.
customer_reviews.author: Matt P

customer_reviews.title: Good..
customer_reviews.text: These seem to be well made and will probably last a while... That being said I bought the xlarge, I wear a size 12 shoe and the socks seem to run a bit smaller than what I usually get.. I will give five pairs away and try another brand. I honestly think they are a good sock but they didn't work for me..
customer_reviews.author: Jake J.

customer_reviews.title: Adidas Socks - Maybe not for large men
customer_reviews.text: These socks didn't have a shoe range. I purchased an XL which was supposed to be 13-15. He can wear the socks but they are tight. He is 6"4" 250 lbs size 15 shoe. He's a big guy. These socks may not be for you if you are around that size.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Monge

customer_reviews.title: Nothing to rave about
customer_reviews.text: Because of Clovis, I decided to by socks on Amazon, I needed good heaving duty socks, for work, these are thin,and small that choke off your leg by the end of day, really disappointed with the description.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for grey crew socks in a XL size (I wear a size 15 shoe). Choices from other brands were very limited, and came across these. Seems difficult to find them in this size at any given time, but waited until they became available. These are very comfortable socks, and look great. The material doesn't seem to be as thick as some of the other brands, so time will tell as to how well they hold up. I bought the crew socks primarily for work, and found the same brand and color in a no show for working out. So far, I really like the comfort and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Winner

customer_reviews.title: Socks doesn’t have the old school logo as pictured
customer_reviews.text: The picture on the ad isn’t what the product looks like! I bought those solely for the old school Adidas logo on the socks. That’s what I thought I was buying. The logo on the actual socks I received are the 3 stripes in a triangular shape. I’m sure a lot of people have bought these partly (if not mostly) for the old school logo. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Roy V

customer_reviews.title: Soft, Comfortable, Breathable and Hold Up Well to Many Washings!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what "ClimaLite" would turn out to be or feel like, but I have always had good quality from Adidas so decided to give them a try. They are on the thinner side so that makes them cooler and breathable, good things.. They are soft and extremely comfortable! They have held up well after many washings. Will definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: EducatedConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and quality but ruins fast
customer_reviews.text: The materials are superb, fit and feel is great and the quality is really good. Issue is after a few weeks the toe and heel area get this greyish color. Always washed as recommended and only after 1 use even if really light use. After few weeks this discoloring happens. I still use them though, as they function and otherwise look as good as new.
customer_reviews.author: Ihab Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, uneven socks
customer_reviews.text: These are like old used mis-matched socks from a thrift store. Too much effort to return. So bad that no one wanted them for free so I threw them in the trash. Huge waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Horrible experience
customer_reviews.text: I am a very small person with really skinny legs. Size 11 feet. I ordered size 12 to 15 and I cannot even get these socks on. They are so thin or skinny around the ankles and calves that I cannot get them on. Who makes this kind of stuff? I can’t believe people would even buy this product or not send it back. My entire life I’m 67 years I have never seen anything so ridiculous
customer_reviews.author: Ed Hueston

customer_reviews.title: Ditch the husband buy the socks.
customer_reviews.text: Husband's a critical prick and wasn't satisfied, but then again he never is. The quality of this product is great!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Storrer

customer_reviews.title: Ordered original adidas leaf logo and got the three stripes logo socks instead
customer_reviews.text: Quality is great, love the support. I did order the original leaf design and instead received the 3 stripes logo which was a bit disappointing. None the less, Adidas quality is always good and would buty
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Socks are ok
customer_reviews.text: Individual socks are good. Fi well. Mild compression. However, 1 don out the st developed a hole in the side of the heel after one wearing. Dropped or broken stitch?
customer_reviews.author: John AB

customer_reviews.title: Comfy socks
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these socks! He says they are his favorite!
customer_reviews.author: Nina Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Decent socks for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Decent socks for the price. Compression around the arch is what I was looking for. I can't respond how they will wear in the long run as I just got them. Sizing was good.
customer_reviews.author: Donald M. Stein

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable socks
customer_reviews.text: My hubby loves these socks so I had to steal a pair and now I want to buy some! They are extra cushioned so they are unbelievably comfortable. They bc me up pretty far on the calf which we both like. And they seem sturdy and will be warm in winter as well as breathable for summer and fall.
customer_reviews.author: teresa

customer_reviews.title: They do not fit a size 15.
customer_reviews.text: These are at best good for up to a size 13. I wear a size 15 shoe. I washed them on cold and air dried them. I had to stretch the heck out of them to get them on. I would have returned them if I had kept the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: David G.

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: I use these socks to work out in. They got holes in them a couple months in. These are very temporary socks. I’ve bought non-name brand socks that lasted a longer time than these.
customer_reviews.author: Yusef farrell

customer_reviews.title: Really Good Sock.... But
customer_reviews.text: These are really good socks and would be perfect with the exception that they are not designed for anyone with big calves. They are much too tight to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Kat S

customer_reviews.title: Holes after 1 wear
customer_reviews.text: I was hopeful about these socks but after 1 wear and 1 wash there are holes forming in the arch of the foot. The holes are not snags/rips but the fabric wearing out.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Good socks
customer_reviews.text: Bought some in store. Liked them a lot. Bought a bunch more online. Seem to be holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Plance

customer_reviews.title: Tight, slick, and already pilling after the very first wash.
customer_reviews.text: These socks started pilling/fuzzing on the very first wash. They feel more like dress socks in the fit than standard athletic socks, which is weird coming from Adidas. There is a band with extra elastic around the arch of the foot which makes for an odd fit, and the synthetic material left my feet sweating. The material also makes the socks more slippery on a hardwood floor than cotton socks.
customer_reviews.author: jbuskohl

customer_reviews.title: Not as pictured
customer_reviews.text: These are not what is pictured. I bought these for the original (retro) adidas logo. These do not have the original logo on them like in the picture. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Brock S.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice socks
customer_reviews.text: I gave a pack of these socks to my 13 yr old grandson for Christmas. Thinking he might not be too excited about getting socks, I tucked a $20 bill in the top of on sock. Much to my surprise he was actually excited to get these socks even before he noticed the money. He really likes these.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail

customer_reviews.title: Good at first - don’t hold up
customer_reviews.text: Bought some Nike Dri-fit and these around the same time - two years ago. These are riddled with holes and look absolutely beaten. The Nike dri fits have held up great. Don’t waste your money, get something that lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Noah P

customer_reviews.title: Socks are a little tight, but help relax aching feet.
customer_reviews.text: Socks are on the tighter side which means they hold in the moisture, which leads to odor. However, they do help relax tired feet and bones.
customer_reviews.author: Mary G.

customer_reviews.title: Don't fit larger legs or feet. 13 shoe, 215lbs
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 13 shoe and these still don't fit when I got the extended larger size. It says 12 - 15? Yeah right. The no show socks in the xlarge size fit but these don't.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: great sock, but not for larger feet
customer_reviews.text: advertised as fitting men size 6-12, but I wear a 9 1/2 shoe and these socks are pretty snug - actually feel good, but I'd say 9 1/2 or maybe 10 is the max, above that, I think they'd be uncomfortably tight
customer_reviews.author: ChrisD

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy these are tiny
customer_reviews.text: I buyed these socks for my husband he wears a size 13 wide and these socks were so small they were so tight on me and I wear size 7 in women's size. Save your money and don't buy this
customer_reviews.author: Hs al

customer_reviews.title: Way Too Tight
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 10 shoe so this was the correct size sock. I could barely fit it over my foot then it wouldn't fit over at all over my ankle and lower calf. Keep in mind this was before washing which usually causes some shrinkage. Not for me, a fast return.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L.

customer_reviews.title: Nice socks
customer_reviews.text: Love these socks. I bought them for my son, I usually take a pair from my kids and give them a pair of mine when I buy them for myself. They're comfortable, somewhat small on me, but perfect for my son and anyone who doesn't have too wide of a foot. The color holds up well also. These have been washed a dozen times at least and they still have good color. They haven't started to get fuzzy either. Great product for a good price. I recommend and I will be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Pippin_410

customer_reviews.title: Great fit...if you have feet like a ballerina
customer_reviews.text: Sure....fits from size 6 to 13? I wanted socks for size 12. It would be easier to stretch a bicycle's inner tube over my foot instead of these tourniquet socks!
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: Too small for me.
customer_reviews.text: The socks were nice enough. I wear a size 10 and they supposedly fit up to size 12. After washing I found them to be too small for me. I had to give them to a friend. Maybe I'm the only one who's had that problem.
customer_reviews.author: A. S. McKnight

customer_reviews.title: Our favorite socks
customer_reviews.text: These are my teenage son’s favorite socks. They are better than most brands at keeping their elasticity, making them easier to get on and off. We have been buying these socks in several colors for about six years.
customer_reviews.author: J. Douglass

customer_reviews.title: Good Fit and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my 16 year old grandson. He says they are the “most comfortable socks he has ever worn” If you can please a 16 year old it is a great product
customer_reviews.author: Russell B. Poole

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend works 2 jobs and they’re very laborious. These socks have withheld his stinky feet and don’t have any holes!!!!! Impressive
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Milam

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting durable socks
customer_reviews.text: I bought another 6 pack of these maybe 5 years ago. since then I have run 10,000 miles plus, most of them in these socks and they just now are starting to wear out...so there you go...you want a quality product that lasts, these are it.
customer_reviews.author: Confetti Heart

customer_reviews.title: Cushioned, Slim-fitting, Long-lasting, Performance
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the most comfortable, thick-cushioned yet slim-fitting, long-lasting performance socks I have ever had! I'm men's size 13 and the XL size fits perfectly. My dad likes them too and he is very conscious about his footwear.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D

customer_reviews.title: A little tight
customer_reviews.text: Size 10 shoe US men’s. Socks are very tight and are difficult to put on despite being listed as compatible with my shoe size. Very comfortable and good looking though.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: My husband's #1 socks
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what my husband wanted! He loves these socks, got them in grey as well for him. He is on his feet all day as a project manager foreman and these are his number 1 socks.
customer_reviews.author: Misty Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great sock
customer_reviews.text: These socks are like the ones I bought at the store. Love these socks. They hold their shape and don’t fade like Nikki.
customer_reviews.author: Chadladage

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: Great discounted price and they seem sturdy. Cut the tags with scissors one by one before dividing them up, do not pull apart. Edit: Still wearing these 5 months later, so don't listen to complainers, these are quality socks.
customer_reviews.author: Leon

customer_reviews.title: My favorite socks
customer_reviews.text: They fit well, they are comfortable and they last long enough to get my dollars. I have bought these many times with no complaints. They usually start going out at the heel when they do wear down.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Socks
customer_reviews.text: Good socks for the price I use them for work think it’s the third time I ordered very happy with them for what I need them for.
customer_reviews.author: L. A

product_meta.title: adidas Men's Athletic Cushioned Crew Socks (6-Pair)
product_meta.description: Quality, comfort, and durability is what you are looking for in your everyday sock and the adidas 6-pack delivers on all of your needs. now, with the addition of arch compression, this sock delivers a secure fit and gives you the best sock to handle your day to day.
feature_bullets: Machine wash in cold with like colors. Non-chlorine bleach. Tumble dry low
Cushioned in the foot for comfort and durability
Moisture-wicking yarns keep feet dry from sweat
Arch compression for a secure fit. Climalite fabric sweeps sweat away from your skin
